headline: Mayo is weirdly great for understanding nuclear fusion experiments
context: A schmear campaign aims to understand how materials transition from elastic to plastic behavior
Connoisseurs call it “creamy,” haters call it “slimy,” and mechanical engineers call it a “soft solid.” Mayonnaise could help scientists better design nuclear fusion experiments.

annotations.paragraph: Mayonnaise’s texture inspires love and loathing. Either way, it’s perfect for physics experiments.
